text:
Hi,
For past couple of months I am having this wierd problem.

Whenever I try to rasterize a SVG into a JPG, the JVM crashes *randomly* and an
hs_err_pid log file is generated. I am not sure why this happens and that too
randomly.

I tested the same program for a couple of months on a 32bit solaris server with
Java 5 and it never crashed. But when i moved the application to 64bit AMD sun
server running redhat enterprise linux (ES release 4), the crashing appears
randomly (roughly 20-30 crashes a day with the program running every 5 minutes).

Has anybody faced this issue ? Or any idea why is it happening and where the
problem lies.

Cheers,
Navneet
creator: navneet.daga@dante.org.uk

text:
Any time the JVM crashes (when you aren't using native libraries) it's a bug in
the JVM.  Do you still get the problem?  If so, then it might be possible to
work around it when running on that specific platform, if you can provide a
stack trace.
creator: cam@apache.org
